intro: Eriogonum fasciculatum, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its clusters of yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as hillsides and grasslands. It has narrow, hairy leaves and a branching stem that produces multiple flower clusters. Eriogonum fasciculatum is an important nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
